channel.title: How do i take out commands out of the server?
channel.description: [size=15pt]how do i take out commands out of the server?[/size]

item.title: How do i take out commands out of the server?
item.dc:creator: @xtgscott xtgscott
item.description:
@xtgscott wrote:

[quote=“deamerdude, post:3, topic:188717”]ok, first is what you want to do is open up your client.java
Then hold control, then press F
then search the command that you want to remove or edit
It should look something like this
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase
NOTE: that is what should be before the command
Once you see the command you wanna remove,
go down until you see two brackets bellow the command,
like this

        }
    }

when you see that, highlight that and the begining of the command and delete it.
when you delete it, save, compile, and restarter your server

I hope i helped you

-DEAMER-[/quote]

Good job stating exactly what I did. =p you did explain it better though. Maybe from now on I’ll go step-by-step in the best detail as possible lol.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i take out commands out of the server?

item.title: How do i take out commands out of the server?
item.dc:creator: @deamerdude deamerdude
item.description:
@deamerdude wrote:

ok, first is what you want to do is open up your client.java
Then hold control, then press F
then search the command that you want to remove or edit
It should look something like this
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase
NOTE: that is what should be before the command
Once you see the command you wanna remove,
go down until you see two brackets bellow the command,
like this

        }
    }

when you see that, highlight that and the begining of the command and delete it.
when you delete it, save, compile, and restarter your server

I hope i helped you

-DEAMER-

item.source: How do i take out commands out of the server?

item.title: How do i take out commands out of the server?
item.dc:creator: @xtgscott xtgscott
item.description:
@xtgscott wrote:

go into client.java and push ctrl + F and search the command name. Find that command you want gone, scroll down to the end } click it and hold and then go up to the "if (command.startswith’COMMANDNAMEHERE’ " and delete it.

Read full topic
